seller_statement: That offer is way too low. I could get way more if I listed it.
response: Totally understand where you’re coming from — on the surface, listing can seem like the better option. But when you factor in time, agent fees, inspections, repairs, and buyer negotiations, the net usually isn’t as high as expected. Our offer is built around netting you something clean and guaranteed — with no uncertainty.
follow_up_prompt: If you didn’t have to worry about showings or waiting months for the right buyer, would something more predictable be worth considering?

seller_statement: I’m not in a rush, so I don’t need to take a lowball offer.
response: Makes total sense — if you’ve got time, you’ve got leverage. What we typically find though is that speed becomes more important when surprises pop up during a sale. Our goal is to give you certainty now and flexibility on closing if needed.
follow_up_prompt: If we could offer something that gave you both a fair price and the ability to move on your timeline, would that be helpful?

seller_statement: Wait, so you’re not actually buying our property?
response: Great question — I get why that might be confusing. What we do is partner with local investors who are actively looking for homes like yours. That lets us bring you a competitive offer, and our team manages the process from A to Z so you’re not stuck doing the legwork.
follow_up_prompt: Would it be helpful if I walked you through exactly how that process works from start to finish?

seller_statement: Just give me a number or don’t bother.
response: Totally respect that — sounds like you’ve had people waste your time before. I want to make sure the number I give actually makes sense based on what you’re working with. Can I ask just 2 quick things about the property so I can avoid guessing?

seller_statement: The house doesn’t need that many repairs — I just replaced the floors.
response: Got it — that’s actually a great start and new flooring is a strong selling point. What we do though is look at the full picture — things like the roof, HVAC, or kitchen layout that investors typically renovate regardless. Our goal isn’t to nitpick, just to make sure we’re not underestimating what’s needed to hit the resale number.
follow_up_prompt: Would it be okay if I walked through what investors typically upgrade even if some items are already newer?

seller_statement: I don’t really need to sell right now.
response: I appreciate you being upfront — honestly, most people we talk to don’t have to sell right away. What tends to happen though is life brings unexpected things that change that. We’re here to be an option if and when it makes sense.
follow_up_prompt: Out of curiosity, is there a number that would make it worth your time to move forward sooner rather than later?

seller_statement: I’ve already got a realtor I’m talking to.
response: Totally understand — it’s smart to weigh your options. What most people don’t realize though is working with us is a completely different route. No showings, no open houses, no waiting. Just a clean, quick sale without fees.
follow_up_prompt: Would it make sense to at least compare the two side by side before committing either way?

seller_statement: Why do you need to know all this? Just make an offer.
response: Great question — I’m not here to waste your time with a random guess. Most sellers actually lose out when someone throws out a number without understanding what they’re working with. A few quick questions helps us make sure the offer we bring actually lines up with your expectations.

seller_statement: I need cash, but I don’t want to get ripped off.
response: Totally hear you — and honestly, that’s the right mindset. Our job isn’t to ‘lowball’ — it’s to bring a number that works for both sides and remove the stress. We’re super transparent, and you’re in control the whole way.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help if I walked you through exactly how our offer is built, and why it’s structured that way?

seller_statement: I’m talking to a few other investors too.
response: That’s smart — you should! Most sellers don’t get multiple opinions and miss out. Just know, our offer isn’t just about price — it’s about certainty, speed, and how we make this painless for you.
follow_up_prompt: Has anyone else walked you through what those offers are really going to net you after all costs?

seller_statement: I’m in pre-foreclosure and I need to sell fast.
response: I’m really sorry you’re in that situation. We’ve helped others in similar spots, and the key here is speed and certainty. If we can verify some details today, we might be able to get things moving quickly for you.
follow_up_prompt: What’s your timeline right now — is the auction date already scheduled, or are you still early in the process?

seller_statement: I’ve had other investors offer more than that.
response: I hear you. Some investors throw out big numbers just to lock the deal in, and then they come back later to renegotiate or cancel altogether. We don’t operate that way — we’re upfront about what we can do, and once we agree, we stick to it.
follow_up_prompt: Did any of those higher offers actually go through, or are you still weighing your options?

seller_statement: How do you even come up with the number you’re offering?
response: Good question — it’s a combination of your property’s condition, the market comps in the area, and what our end buyer would need to make it worth the risk. I can walk you through the logic if you’d like.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help if I explained how we look at comps and repair costs on our side?

seller_statement: How do I know this isn’t a scam?
response: I completely understand — there are a lot of sketchy operators out there. What I can tell you is that we’re fully transparent, we’ll never ask you to sign anything you’re not comfortable with, and we’re happy to walk through everything step-by-step.
follow_up_prompt: What kind of red flags are you looking out for, just so I can ease your mind?

seller_statement: This used to be my mom’s house, it’s hard to even talk about selling it.
response: I’m really sorry to hear that. That kind of decision is incredibly personal. Whatever we do, it’ll be at your pace and with full respect for what this home meant to your family.
follow_up_prompt: Are there any memories tied to this house you’d want honored if it changes hands?
